definition: urgent and important moment (idiom); critical juncture
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to demand/to request/to coerce
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: We are at a critical moment in our history.
sentences.chinese: 我们正处于历史的紧要关头。

sentences.english: A friend is someone who will come to help you in a pinch.
sentences.chinese: 所谓朋友，就是在紧要关头肯来帮助你的人。

sentences.english: The fate of our people hangs in the balance.
sentences.chinese: 我的族人们的命运正处在紧要关头。

sentences.english: They arrived in the nick of time to save us.
sentences.chinese: 在紧要关头他们正好赶到来救我们。

sentences.english: Ever notice that most dreams have a blood-surging urgency to them?
sentences.chinese: 可曾记得，大部分的梦都有一段惊心动魄的紧要关头？

sentences.english: When it comes to the point, she always shrinks back.
sentences.chinese: 每逢到了紧要关头，她总是临阵退缩。

sentences.english: We are at a critical time in our history.
sentences.chinese: 我们处在历史的紧要关头。

sentences.english: He appeared at the psychological moment to prevent me from being bitten by the dog.
sentences.chinese: 他出现在紧要关头才使我未被狗咬着。

sentences.english: There is no guarantee of rationality in these showdowns.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的紧要关头没有合理的保证。

sentences.english: Ulla, a young Swedish woman caught in the moment of crucial decision.
sentences.chinese: 乌拉，一位处在紧要关头下的年轻瑞典妇女。

definition: juncture/moment
the critical moment/life and death crisis
at that moment/just then
a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
matter of life and death
matter of life and death
vitally important/a matter of life and death
(dialect) critical juncture/crucial moment/Taiwan pr. [jie2 gu5 yan3]
dangerous situation/venerable old age
calamity
facing a powerful enemy (idiom); fig. confronting grave difficulties/Enemy at the Gates, 1991 movie by Jean-Jacques Annaud
critical/desperate (situation)
critical circumstances/risky conditions/danger zone
perilous situation
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
